item.title: Web
item.description: Web fundamentals: HTTP, REST, GraphQL, WebSockets. Protocols, standards, and API design principles.

item.title: Testing
item.description: Testing strategies from unit to integration to E2E. Includes TDD workflows, test containers, and property-based testing.

item.title: Security
item.description: Application security, OWASP Top 10, authentication patterns (OAuth, JWT), encryption, and secure coding practices.

item.title: Programming Languages
item.description: Programming languages beyond C#: F#, Rust, Go, TypeScript. Paradigms, type systems, and polyglot thinking.

item.title: Performance
item.description: Performance optimization: profiling, caching strategies, memory management, benchmarking with BenchmarkDotNet, and Span/Memory APIs.

item.title: Design Patterns
item.description: Classic and modern design patterns: SOLID, CQRS, Event Sourcing, Repository, Mediator. When to apply and when to avoid.

item.title: Observability
item.description: Logging, monitoring, and distributed tracing. Tools like OpenTelemetry, Grafana, Prometheus, and structured logging with Serilog.

item.title: Messaging
item.description: Message queues and event-driven architecture: RabbitMQ, Kafka, Azure Service Bus. Async communication between services.

item.title: Linux
item.description: Linux administration, shell scripting, CLI tools, and system internals. Essential knowledge for backend and DevOps work.

item.title: Infrastructure
item.description: Cloud platforms, containerization with Docker, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code.
